name.namePart: United States District Court District of Massachusetts

originInfo.publisher: Administrative Office of the United States Courts

name.namePart: United States District Court District of Massachusetts

titleInfo.title: Dempsey v. Gnandt
titleInfo.subTitle: Judge George A. OToole, Jr: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER entered: Plaintiff's Motion for Leave to Proceed in forma pauperis (Docket Nos. 2 and 3) are ALLOWED; Plaintiff's Motion for a Referral to the Attorney General (Docket No. 4) is DENIED; Plaintiff's Motion for Free Service of Process by the U.S. Marshal (Docket No. 6) is DENIED without prejudice; Plaintiff's Motion for Inquiry Obstruction of Justice Inquiry Regarding Mount Auburn Hospital President Janette Clough (Docket No. 7) is DENIED; Plaintiff's Motion for Summary Judgment (Docket No. 8) is DENIED; Within 35 days of the date of this Memorandum and Order, Plaintiff shall demonstrate good cause why this action should not be dismissed or he shall file a coherent Amended Complaint curing the pleading deficiencies; and Plaintiff is PROHIBITED from filing any further requests for preliminary relief until after a responsive pleading is filed by the Defendant if this action is permitted to proceed further. (PSSA, 1)

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Massachusetts
extension.docketText: Judge George A. OToole, Jr: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER entered: Plaintiff's Motion for Leave to Proceed in forma pauperis (Docket Nos. 2 and 3) are ALLOWED; Plaintiff's Motion for a Referral to the Attorney General (Docket No. 4) is DENIED; Plaintiff's Motion for Free Service of Process by the U.S. Marshal (Docket No. 6) is DENIED without prejudice; Plaintiff's Motion for Inquiry Obstruction of Justice Inquiry Regarding Mount Auburn Hospital President Janette Clough (Docket No. 7) is DENIED; Plaintiff's Motion for Summary Judgment (Docket No. 8) is DENIED; Within 35 days of the date of this Memorandum and Order, Plaintiff shall demonstrate good cause why this action should not be dismissed or he shall file a coherent Amended Complaint curing the pleading deficiencies; and Plaintiff is PROHIBITED from filing any further requests for preliminary relief until after a responsive pleading is filed by the Defendant if this action is permitted to proceed further. (PSSA, 1)

titleInfo.title: Dempsey v. Gnandt
titleInfo.subTitle: Judge George A. OToole, Jr: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER entered: Plaintiff's Motion for Immediate Suspension of Proceeding Enemy Alien Status (Docket No. 10) is DENIED; Plaintiff is CAUTIONED against the continued filing of abusive, malicious, or vexatious pleadings and advised that such filings may result in the imposition of sanctions; Plaintiffs "Motion for 18 U.S.C.A. 521(A) Criminal Street Gang Be Declared Domestic Terrorist Group Title 18 U.S.C.A. 2331(5)(A) in Regards Late Graf of Myanmar (1979) Burned and Crippled Son 18 U.S.C.A. 1116(b)(1)" (Docket No. 13) is DENIED; Plaintiff's Motion for Reconsideration (Docket No. 11) is DENIED; andThis action is DISMISSED in its entirety. (PSSA, 1)
